name: Primes p such that between p and the next prime there exist 2 distinct integers which are a square and a cube, respectively.
example: 113 is a term because between prime 113 and next prime 127 there exists a square 121 and a cube 125.
author: _Zhining Yang_, Jan 26 2025

name: Primes p such that between p and the previous prime there exist 2 distinct integers which are a square and a cube, respectively.
example: 127 is a term because between prime 127 and previous prime 113 there exists a square 121 and a cube 125.
author: _Zhining Yang_, Jan 26 2025

name: Positive cubes k such that there are no primes between k and the nearest square that is not k.
example: 125 is a term because it is a cube and there are no primes between 125 and 121, its nearest square.
author: _Zhining Yang_, Jan 26 2025

name: Squares k such that there are no primes between k and the nearest cube that is not k.
example: 121 is a term because it is a square and there are no primes between 123 and 125, its nearest cube.
author: _Zhining Yang_, Jan 26 2025
